data.title: Paris 2024 Preview - Men's Lightweight Double
data.meta_description: Racing for the 2024 Olympic Regatta begins on Saturday, July 27, in Paris, France. Below, we preview the men's lightweight double.
data.text:
Racing for the 2024 Olympic Regatta begins on Saturday, July 27, in Paris, France. Below, we preview the men's lightweight double.

2023 WORLD CHAMPION - McCarthy/O'Donovan - IRL

2020 OLYMPIC CHAMPION - McCarthy/O'Donovan - IRL

2024 SCHEDULE

Heats on Sunday, Reps on Monday, Semis on Wednesday, Finals on Friday

ENTRIES - 16

ARGENTINA - Alejandro Colomino | Pedro Dickson

BELGIUM - Niels van Zandweghe | Tibo Vyvey

CHILE - Cesar Abaroa | Eber Sanhueza

CZECH REPUBLIC - Jiri Simanek | Miroslav Vrastil

EGYPT - Mohamed Kota | Ahmed Abdelaal

FRANCE - Hugo Beurey | Ferdinand Ludwig

GREECE - Antonios Papakonstantiou | Petros Gkaidatzis

IRELAND - Fintan McCarthy | Paul O'Donovan

ITALY - Stefano Oppo | Gabriel Soares

JAPAN - Masayuki Miyaura | Naoki Furuta

MEXICO - Miguel Nieto | Alexis Garcia

NORWAY - Lars Benske | Ask Jarl Tjoem

SPAIN - Dennis Ferrero | Caetano Pombo

SWITZERLAND - Jan Schaeuble | Raphael Ireland

UKRAINE - Igor Khmara | Stanislav Kovalov

UZBEKISTAN - Shakhzod Nurmatov | Sobirjon Safaroliyev

BELGRADE 2023 RECAP

The Czech double of Simanek and Vrastil had the fastest start, but the entire field raced through the 500m mark with a deck of each other. In the second 500, the Swiss combo of Schaeuble and Ireland moved into the lead, taking nearly a length on the rest of the crews with the favored Irish crew moving into second. McCarthy and O'Donovan of Ireland inched into the lead in the third 500, with Italy taking control over third place, open water on fourth. At the finish, Ireland had pushed out to a length lead to repeat as world champions, with Switzerland holding off a sprint from Italy to claim the silver.

Watch the final here.

2024 SEASON RECAP

WORLD CUP I

Three doubles qualified for Paris made the A Final in Varese, with Italy sprinting through Switzerland to take the gold by just under half a second. Norway finished in third, another three seconds behind the Swiss.

EUROPEAN CHAMPIONSHIPS

The Swiss double led from start to finish to take the gold in Hungary in a field that featured five of the six finalists from the 2023 World Championships. Italy finished in second, just ahead of Norway with Czech and Spain rounding out the top five.

FOPQR

The two qualification spots for Paris were won by France and Greece.

WORLD CUP II

Ireland made their only appearance in 2024 in Lucerne, but were unable to keep the pace, finishing in third place behind both Italy and Switzerland. Norway, Spain, and Belgium rounded out the field all about five seconds out of the medals.

WORLD CUP III

France dominated the four boat final in Poznan, defeating Mexico by nearly eight seconds with Argentina in fourth, another four seconds behind Mexico.

USA PROSPECTS

There will be no USA entry in the LM2x for the Paris Olympics Games. The NYAC/Green Racing Project composite crew of Sam Melvin and Cooper Tuckerman did not advance to the A Final at the FOPQR, failing to qualify for Paris.
